name: Peasant's Quest! GB Remake
description:
A real long time ago, in the peasant kingdom of Peasantry, some people lived... in fear. You are Rather Dashing, a peasant wearing short pants, who returns from vacation to find his thatched-roof cottage BURNINATED! You swear revenge and embark on an incredible journey to vanquish Trogdor the Burninator once and for all!

What began as the best-selling video computer/TV game of all time (but, not really) has been remastered for the portable. 

The classic text-based computer adventure has been re-imagined for the small screen. Make your way through the lush 4 color landscapes of Peasantry.  Using the state-of-the-art D-pad and "A" or "Z" button!

Playable in a browser, any gameboy emulator, or on the Compy Gamebe´ 286 P (TM)!

Compy Gamebe´ 286 P:

Weighing a slightly portable 2.5 lbs, the Compy Gamebe´ 286 P with optional battery pack attachment (sold separately) features an impressive 8-bit 4-color dot matrix screen, uses 16 AA batteries, and boasts an impressive battery life of up to 1.35 hours (actual use may vary). Perfect for playing Peasant's Quest during those family car rides in between games of i-spy and 20 questions.

Featuring a directional pad, 2 action buttons Z & X. And Select and Start. 

(Cannot legally take on any international or domestic flights.)

Instructions:

Look around, talk to people. Use "A" or "Z" to interact with people or objects. 

Press "Select" or "Shift" to view MAP.

Press "Start" or "Enter" to pause/view points.

Start is "Enter" on browser.

This is a fan remake, all properties belong to the Brothers' Chaps and the guys at homestarrunner.com.  I do not own any rights to this game. This is very much a draft/concept. Hopefully I will update later. 

This is also the first/only game I've ever made. The artwork isn't good, the sound is even worse. I used some assets from Chassers Gaming, sonDanielson, and of course, Chris Maltby. Created using GB Studio.
